slides.title: Welcome to GST Invoicing
slides.content:
# GST Invoicing

Proper invoicing is **critical for ITC** and compliance.

## What You Will Learn

- **Tax Invoice** - Mandatory contents
- **Other Documents** - Debit/Credit notes
- **E-Invoicing** - Electronic system
- **E-Way Bill** - Transport document

## Topics

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Tax invoice | Contents, timing |
| Notes | Debit, credit |
| E-invoice | IRN system |
| E-way bill | Transport |

slides.title: Tax Invoice
slides.content:
# Mandatory Document

## When Required

| Supply | Invoice Required |
|--------|------------------|
| Goods | Before dispatch |
| Services | Within 30 days |
| Continuous | As per milestones |

## Contents (Rule 46)

| Field | Requirement |
|-------|-------------|
| Supplier name/GSTIN | Mandatory |
| Invoice number | Sequential |
| Date | Date of issue |
| Recipient details | Name, address |
| HSN/SAC | Code |
| Tax details | CGST, SGST, IGST |

slides.title: Invoice Format
slides.content:
# Required Fields

## Detailed Contents

```
1. Supplier name, address, GSTIN
2. Invoice number (max 16 characters)
3. Date of issue
4. Recipient details (if registered)
5. HSN/SAC codes
6. Description of goods/services
7. Quantity and unit
8. Total value
9. Taxable value
10. Tax rate and amount
11. Place of supply
12. Signature/digital signature
```

## HSN Requirement

| Turnover | HSN Digits |
|----------|------------|
| < Rs 5 Cr | 4 digits |
| >= Rs 5 Cr | 6 digits |

slides.title: Invoice Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Service invoice must be issued within?

slides.title: Bill of Supply
slides.content:
# For Exempt Suppliers

## When Issued

| Scenario | Document |
|----------|----------|
| Exempt supply | Bill of supply |
| Composition dealer | Bill of supply |
| Nil rated | Bill of supply |

## Contents

```
Similar to tax invoice
but NO TAX MENTIONED

- Supplier details
- Description
- Value
- Serial number
- Date
```

slides.title: Debit and Credit Notes
slides.content:
# Adjusting Documents

## Debit Note

| Scenario | Use |
|----------|-----|
| Price increase | After supply |
| Additional tax | Discovered later |

## Credit Note

| Scenario | Use |
|----------|-----|
| Price reduction | After supply |
| Goods returned | Sales return |
| Excess tax | Correction |

## Time Limit

```
Credit note must be issued by:
- 30th November of following FY
- Or annual return date
```

slides.title: Receipt Voucher and Refund Voucher
slides.content:
# Advance and Refund

## Receipt Voucher

| Purpose | When |
|---------|------|
| Advance received | Before supply |
| Tax liability | On advance |

## Refund Voucher

| Purpose | When |
|---------|------|
| Advance refunded | Supply not made |
| Adjustment | Against receipt |

## Note

```
Advance GST:
- Applicable for services
- Not for goods (since Nov 2017)
```

slides.title: E-Invoicing
slides.content:
# Electronic Invoicing

## Applicability

| Turnover | Requirement |
|----------|-------------|
| > Rs 5 Cr | Mandatory |
| < Rs 5 Cr | Not required |

## Process

```
1. Generate invoice in software
2. Upload to IRP (Invoice Registration Portal)
3. Get IRN (Invoice Reference Number)
4. QR code generated
5. Signed invoice returned
```

## IRN

- 64-character unique number
- Hash of GSTIN + Doc type + Doc number + FY

slides.title: E-Invoice Benefits
slides.content:
# System Advantages

## Benefits

| Benefit | Impact |
|---------|--------|
| Auto-population | GSTR-1 |
| ITC matching | Easier |
| Reduced fraud | Verification |
| Interoperability | Standard format |

## Auto-Population

```
E-invoice data flows to:
- GSTR-1 (supplier)
- GSTR-2A (recipient)
- E-way bill (if applicable)
```

slides.title: E-Way Bill
slides.content:
# Transport Document

## When Required

| Value | E-Way Bill |
|-------|------------|
| > Rs 50,000 | Mandatory |
| < Rs 50,000 | Optional |

## Who Generates

| Scenario | Generator |
|----------|----------|
| Registered supplier | Supplier |
| Unregistered supplier | Recipient |
| Transporter | Transporter |

## Validity

| Distance | Validity |
|----------|----------|
| < 100 km | 1 day |
| Every 100 km | Additional day |

slides.title: E-Invoice Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: E-invoicing is mandatory for turnover above?

slides.title: E-Way Bill Details
slides.content:
# Document Contents

## Part A

| Field | Requirement |
|-------|-------------|
| GSTIN | Supplier/recipient |
| Place of dispatch | From |
| Place of delivery | To |
| Invoice details | Number, date |
| HSN | Code |
| Value | Invoice value |

## Part B

| Field | Requirement |
|-------|-------------|
| Transporter | GSTIN or ID |
| Vehicle number | If known |
| Mode | Road, rail, etc. |

slides.title: Exemptions from E-Way Bill
slides.content:
# Not Required

## Exempt Movements

| Category | Exemption |
|----------|----------|
| < Rs 50,000 | Value threshold |
| Non-motorized | Manual transport |
| Port to ICD | Customs bond |
| Empty cargo | Return containers |
| Listed goods | Specific exemptions |

## State-Wise

```
Some states have:
- Lower threshold
- State-specific rules
- Additional requirements
```

slides.title: Invoice Matching
slides.content:
# ITC Reconciliation

## Matching Process

```
Supplier GSTR-1
    |
    v
Recipient GSTR-2A/2B
    |
    v
ITC Claim in GSTR-3B
```

## Mismatch Handling

| Scenario | Action |
|----------|--------|
| Invoice missing | Follow up |
| Amount mismatch | Correct |
| GSTIN error | Amendment |

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You completed **GST Invoicing**!

## Key Topics

### Documents
- Tax invoice
- Bill of supply
- Debit/Credit notes

### E-Invoicing
- IRN generation
- Auto-population
- > Rs 5 Cr threshold

### E-Way Bill
- > Rs 50,000 value
- 1 day per 100 km
- Part A and B

## Key Thresholds

| Document | Threshold |
|----------|----------|
| E-invoice | Rs 5 Cr turnover |
| E-way bill | Rs 50,000 value |
| HSN 6-digit | Rs 5 Cr turnover |

## What is Next?

Explore GST Returns!
